content.text: On the Venn diagrams below, shade the region corresponding to the set given below Venn diagram
All students in the football team are boys
There are no students who are in both the swimming team and the football team.
It is given that sets \(\mathcal{E}, B, S\) and \(F\) are such that
Express each of the following statements in set notation
Find the rate of change of \(x\) with respect to \(t\) when \(t = \frac{\pi}{6}\)
The rate of change of a variable \(y\) with respect to time \(t\) is \(3\sin t\)
Using your result from part (i), find the rate of change of \(y\) with respect to \(x\) when \(t = \frac{\pi}{6}\) .
The rate of change of a variable \(x\) with respect to time \(t\) is \(4\cos^2 t\)
there are no restrictions,
the committee must consist of 2 women and 5 men,
the committee must contain at least 1 woman
A committee of 7 members is to be selected from 6 women and 9 men. Find the number of different committees that may be selected if
On the axes below sketch, for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \pi\), the graphs of
Write down
the coordinates of the stationary points on the curve \(y = 1 + 3\sin 2x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \pi\),
the number of solutions of the equation \(\tan x = 1 + 3\sin 2x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \pi\)
the bearing on which the plane must be steered,
the time taken to fly from \(A\) to \(B\)

A pilot flies his plane directly from a point \(A\) to a point \(B\), a distance of \(450\mathrm{km}\). The bearing from \(A\) is \(030^{\circ}\). A wind of \(80\mathrm{km}\mathrm{h}^{- 1}\) is blowing from the east. Given that the plane can travel \(320\mathrm{km}\mathrm{h}^{- 1}\) in still air, find
Find the value of \(p\)
Use your value of \(p\) to find the term independent of \(x\) in the expansion of \((p + x)^{6}\left(1 - \frac{1}{x}\right)^{2}\)
In the expansion of \((p + x)^{6}\), where \(p\) is a positive integer, the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) is equal to 1.5 times the coefficient of \(x^{3}\)
Find the greatest distance of \(P\) from \(O\)
Find the acceleration of \(P\) at the instant when \(P\) is at its greatest distance from \(O\)
A particle \(P\) moves along the \(x\)-axis such that its distance, \(x\mathrm{m}\), from the origin \(O\) at time \(t\)
given by \(x = \frac{t}{t^2 + 1}\) for \(t \geqslant 0\)
Given that \(3x^{3} + 5x^{2} + px + 8 \equiv (x - 2)(ax^{2} + bx + c)\), find the value of each of the terms \(a, b, c\) and \(p\)
Using the values found in part (i), factorise completely \(3x^{3} + 5x^{2} + px + 8\).
Find the perimeter of \(ABCD\)
Find the area of \(ABCD\)

The diagram shows four straight lines, \(AD\) , \(BC\) , \(AC\) and \(BD\). Lines \(AC\) and \(BD\) intersect at \(O\) such that angle \(AOB\) is \(\frac{\pi}{6}\) radians. \(AB\) is an arc of the circle, centre \(O\) and radius \(10\mathrm{cm}\), and \(CD\) is an arc of the circle, centre \(O\) and radius \(20\mathrm{cm}\)
Solve \(\tan^{2}x - 2\sec x + 1 = 0\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\)
Solve \(\cos^2 3y = 5\sin^2 3y\) for \(0 \leqslant y \leqslant 2\) radians
Solve \(2 \mathrm{cosec}\left(z + \frac{\pi}{4}\right) = 5\) for \(0 \leqslant z \leqslant 6\) radians
Find the coordinates of \(P\)
The area of the region enclosed by the curve \(y = 5\mathrm{e}^{x} + 3\mathrm{e}^{- x}\), the \(y\)-axis, the positive \(x\)-axis and the line \(x = a\) is 12 square units
Show that \(5\mathrm{e}^{2a} - 14\mathrm{e}^{a} - 3 = 0.\)
Hence find the value of \(a\)
The tangent to the curve \(y = 5\mathrm{e}^{x} + 3\mathrm{e}^{- x}\) at the point where \(x = \ln \frac{3}{5}\) , meets the \(x\)-axis at the point \(P\)

Given that \(y = \frac{3\mathrm{e}^{2x}}{1 + \mathrm{e}^{2x}}\) , show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{A\mathrm{e}^{2x}}{\left(1 + \mathrm{e}^{2x}\right)^2}\) , where \(A\) is a constant to be found.
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve \(y = \frac{3\mathrm{e}^{2x}}{1 + \mathrm{e}^{2x}}\) at the point where the curve crosses the \(y\)-axis

Using your result from part (i), find \(\int \frac{\mathrm{e}^{2x}}{\left(1 + \mathrm{e}^{2x}\right)^2} \mathrm{~d}x\) and hence evaluate \(\int_{0}^{\ln 3} \frac{\mathrm{e}^{2x}}{\left(1 + \mathrm{e}^{2x}\right)^2} \mathrm{~d}x\)
Answer only **one** of the following two alternatives
